stories.text:
If you were to choose one book (or maybe more than one :P) to lure a curious person to your field of study, which will you choose?

For example: How to Design Programs for Computer Science.

Note: It has to be inviting for someone that knows nothing about the field but becomes hooked after reading it. Not some epitome which is revered by experts only.
stories.title: Ask HN: Which book can attract anyone towards your field of study?
BlocklyML visual programming tool for Machine learning and Python

Black Tesla employees describe a culture of racism: ‘I was at my breaking point’
Just where is Joe Biden going to find gas for the EU?
An Interview with Zach Wade Betz
Artificial Intelligence and the Manufacturing of Reality (2020)

stories.text: And isn't it a daunting name for new users? For a long time I thought Discord was a distributed system where server owners needed to host the server to store all the chat histories.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why are Discord servers called “servers”?
